text: Du Runsheng (; July 18, 1913 â€“ October 9, 2015) was a Chinese military officer, revolutionary leader, politician, and economist. He was described as "China's father of rural reform". Du was a member of the 12th and 13th National People's Congress and a member of the Central Advisory Commission from 1987 through 1992. He was born in Taigu County, Shanxi. He died in Beijing, China, at the age of 102. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Chinese centenarians Category:Chinese communist politicians Category:Chinese military people Category:Chinese economists Category:Politicians from Shanxi Category:20th-century Chinese people Category:21st-century Chinese people Category:20th-century Chinese politicians Category:21st-century Chinese politicians Category:21st-century Chinese military people Category:20th-century Chinese military people
title: Du Runsheng
